result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Marshall Eugene Pilgram. Defendant Marshall Eugene Pilgram not in court. Set for PLEAS. Atty Schutte makes statements; notes he received a call and letter this morning that DE has checked himself into I/P treatment. Atty Damrau asks to set this out, to allow DE time for treatment. Atty Schutte notes discharge is set for 11/25. Adjourned: 11:33 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

DE called to check when his next court date was, states he knows it's in November but can't remember the exact date and time.  Clerk advised it's today at 11:30.  DE states he's in an in treatment program at New Beginnings in MN, he was just admitted.  Clerk advised DE to contact Atty Schutte ASAP to inform him of this information.  Clerk gave DE Atty Schutte's phone number and email address, advised to contact JA's office if can't get ahold of Atty. bph

10:00 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marshall Eugene Pilgram in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Marshall Eugene Pilgram. Court notes warrant for non-payment of attorney fees. Atty. Schutte states that DE has been in treatment, unemployed and is unable to pay at this time. Court quashes warrant and suspends payment plan. Court advises DE to contact public defender to inquire if he qualifies for their services not that he is unemployed. WOPH: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ARGN: Def understands possible penalties.  Waives reading.  NG. Court sets PLEAS. DE updates address.  Adjourned: 10:07. kma

From DE stating his pymt was due yest, he can't make pymt for at least 2 wks b/c he's in treatment & just started a new job. CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood, NONA by def. Court notes this matter is set for an initial appearance at 1 p.m. It is now 1:30 p.m. Court reviews file. DE was issued a summons to appear today. DE does not appear. State requesting a warrant. Due to non appearance, Court will issue warrant, extraditable adjoining states.
